text: "To say that virtual pre-K didn’t go well would be an understatement. On day one Raffi cried, screamed, hit his parents, hit his brother, broke things, and spat a cup of juice all over my laptop," @EmilyGould writes: https://t.co/j7buiYC6WR

text: Democrats refused to trust any single rising star with a prime speaking spot on Tuesday night, but convention organizers still plan to highlight someone who party elders believe could be the next president, @AdamHSays writes https://t.co/0CtTwtmZfQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: The "Karen" meme is so powerful, @helenlewis writes, because it poses an impossible question: Does whiteness immunize you from the effects of misogyny? https://t.co/j2ODOG3yoC

name: TheAtlantic
text: Being a COVID-19 long-hauler in August is very different from being one in February, @edyong209 writes. Newer long-haulers have bustling veterans to learn from and better access to medical care. But for many, there's no end in sight. https://t.co/Bybfk36F9b

name: TheAtlantic
text: How should families manage their pandemic bubbles as schools reopen? @jameshamblin offers advice to a grandmother on how to safely help her daughter with child care: https://t.co/tIOMV4fMsk

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Host," which takes place entirely on a computer screen during a séance over Zoom, is the first great “quarantine horror" film, @ehorkley writes: https://t.co/Qcg1mz7qWU

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Whether or not the Trump campaign illegally coordinated with the Kremlin, Trump has no grounds for proclaiming vindication, much less that he’s the victim of a witch hunt," @FranklinFoer writes: https://t.co/viNjZ4dUBq

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The biases against Harris are not reducible to the racism that afflicted Barack Obama plus the sexism and misogyny that Hillary Clinton encountered," @kate_manne writes: https://t.co/R2FDkBRqOk

text: The divide between red and blue America is only deepening as 2020 goes on—and is likely to intensify after the election is over, @RonBrownstein writes: https://t.co/MM6sPX5jow

text: "The traditional, bipartisan story line—of America as a nation with a historic and exceptional commitment to freedom—endorsed even by Obama, convinces far fewer Democrats than it once did," @PeterBeinart writes: https://t.co/1ds6Nm5dVp

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @RonBrownstein: 2020's divide in a nutshell: Dems turned over their convention keynote to a split-screen array of 17 diverse young leaders one day after news leaked that Rs had invited to speak at their ctn the white suburban couple who brandished guns at BLM protesters. https://t.co/cPLycumfg6

text: RT @prashantrao: "Hanging over white women’s decision on which way to jump is a classic finger trap, familiar to anyone who has confronted a sexist joke, only to be told that they don’t have a sense of humor. What is more Karen than complaining about being called “Karen”?" https://t.co/9cPhEeb4wf

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: "It was faster-paced than speeches of years past, which likely made it easier for viewers to digest. text: Evacuations are under way as wildfires rage in California. Last year, @yayitsrob reported that the state’s wildfires have quintupled in size over the past five decades—an upheaval driven by climate change: https://t.co/UYWY2fOPmU

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: "If a majority of working-class and Christian white America responds to Trump’s openly racist appeals" now, when they represent about 40% of the population, "there’s little to suggest they will be *less* responsive to such arguments as their share falls" https://t.co/RJDevhp8Yy

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @ibogost: Seems like people are much more sneery at Oracle as a possible TikTok buyer than Microsoft. Oracle has less of a consumer-tech history, but, I'm not sure why the difference otherwise?

As I wrote here, the real value in TikTok is its AI, not its app.
https://t.co/Bgppgm2pcd
